intro: Muehlenbeckia andina, commonly known as the Andean muhly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats or cushions. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces tiny, clustered flowers that are often pink or white. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Muehlenbeckia andina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in arid regions.
